meanings.definition: A chignon is a hairstyle in which the hair is twisted or plaited into a knot at the back of the head.
meanings.sent1: At the party, she wore an elegant chignon that showcased her long hair beautifully.
meanings.sent2: Many brides choose to have chignons for their wedding day to look sophisticated.
meanings.sent3: The chignon was so big, it almost looked like a fluffy cloud on her head!
meanings.sent4: Her chignon was like a neat little nest of hair, perfectly perched at the nape of her neck.
meanings.sent5: The chignon was a work of art, a masterpiece of hair styling.

meanings.definition: Chignons can be worn for formal occasions or everyday wear.
meanings.sent1: For the ballet performance, the dancers all had matching chignons to complete their look.
meanings.sent2: Some people prefer chignons for work as they are easy to maintain throughout the day.
meanings.sent3: She surprised everyone by wearing a chignon to the casual picnic in the park.
meanings.sent4: The chignons at the event were like a sea of elegant knots bobbing in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: Her chignon was a versatile choice, suitable for both a business meeting and a dinner date.

meanings.definition: She styled her hair into a chignon for the wedding.
meanings.sent1: Before the ceremony, she carefully chignoned her hair to create a classic look.
meanings.sent2: It took her only a few minutes to chignon her hair into a neat bun for the party.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly asked if he could chignon his hair too for the special occasion.
meanings.sent4: She chignoned her hair with such precision that not a single strand was out of place.
meanings.sent5: The hairstylist expertly chignoned her hair, turning it into a glamorous updo for the event.
